resources.string: Choose the average area size S of one string opening in the center of the stringbed (measured in square millimetres): S=a√ób (a,b are the distances between 2 main and 2 cross neighbouring strings respectively in millimetres).
Head size should be between %1$d and %2$d %3$s.

Calibration:
 1. Take a racquet with known string tension
 2. Enter this racquet and its string parameters in the settings
 3. Tap the string close to the microphone
 4. After the Factory measurement is done push the Calibrate button and enter the known tension.

The full capacity of TennisTension can be understood and reached when is used with the provided proper Calibration. There are several important factors to consider:


Tension Loss - starts during stringing and at very high rate during the first couple of hours after stringing and the first 30 minutes of play.


Type and model of the string with all its characteristics.


Stringing machine


Stringer abilities and stringing habits

To make YOUR perfect Calibration you have to pick a racquet with YOUR string strung by a trusted stringer at desired tension couple of hours after stringing. Enter the racquet and string parameters in the settings. Tap the string anywhere with anything close to the bottom of the phone where the microphone is mounted. After you see that the Factory measurement is done push the Calibrate button and enter the preknown desired average tension between the main and cross strings you gave to your trusted stringer in advance. The Calibration is done and is ready for use.

The user has to learn how to produce the proper ringing sound close (2 to 10 cm) and in front of the phone microphone. Find the microphone which uses single, very small hole either at the top or at the bottom of the phone.

Remove the dampener!

Tap the racquet string very gently several times every 1 or 2 sec. with a stiff object. The easiest way to produce a good ringing sound is using a pen or pencil, or use another racquet, fingernails, etc.

While ringing, the resonating racquet string must stay 2 to 10 cm from the microphone, in front of it, especially in a noisier environment. It is shown well in the YouTube video provided for TennisTension mobile app.

To receive the exact momentous string tension, define all the necessary racquet and string parameters. If you don't know some of the them, default average values are taken for the calculations, or the last values that the user put it in.

TennisTension measures the average tension between main and cross strings of the racquet (for example, if a racquet is strung 25/24 kg, the measurement result will be 24.5 kg).

String tensions of hybrid strings could be measured as well.

The error of the measurement result is less than 0.2 kg.

Use the "Calibration" to cope COMPLETELY with all specific characteristics of every racquet, string and stringing machine/stringer combination.
